biography.paragraph1:
Woody Prieb or formally Dr. Vuthiphong Priebjrivat is a rare combination of academic, corporate, political and spiritual accomplishments. Woody, as affectionately nick-named by his friends and colleagues, is currently president of Sahasavas Institute, a nonprofit public policy research institute.

Regarding his educational background, Woody ranked first in Thailand’s National Examination (1970). He was awarded the King’s Scholarship (1970-1975) and later the Rockefeller Scholarship (1977-1984) to further his education in the United States. Woody received a B.S. in civil engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology or MIT (1975); an M.S. in environmental engineering from Stanford University (1976); and an M.B.A. and a Ph.D. in economics and public management from the University of Chicago (1979 and 1984). He has also received numerous other awards including a Citibank International Fellowship (1992 and 1998) and a Fulbright Award (1993).

Woody began his career in academics by teaching at Thailand’s prestigious Thammasat University (1977–1986) and was a visiting professor in America at the University of North Carolina (1992 and 1998). He had written extensively for academic and professional journals on topics covering economics, finance, business and public policy.

In his business career, Woody served as vice president for corporate planning at Bangkok Bank (1988–1992), the largest commercial bank in Thailand. Later, he helped found Thailand’s first credit rating agency, Thai Rating and Information Services or TRIS; and was its president for the first five years (1993–1998).
biography.paragraph2:
Over the years, he has also served in advisory capacity for many various organizations --business, government, academic and professional-- such as: the World Bank; Thai Parliament; National Economic and Social Development Board (NESDB); Civil Service Commission (CSC); Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand (EGAT); Government Pharmaceutical Organization (GPO); Padaeng Industry (zinc mining) and Asia Credit Securities (stock brokerage).

After his success in business, Woody embarked on a new challenge: political activism. Related to this is the setting up of a public policy research institute, Sahasavas (1999). Later, he served as a member of the Thai National Legislative Assembly (2006–2008); and as president of TOT Corp, Thailand’s national telecom company (2007). During this period, he wrote a best-selling political satire, Corruptology: The Art and Science of Political Corruption (2000); along with a few political critiques on various topics, which were later compiled into a few other books.

Another important facet of his life is his deep interest in religions, spirituality and metaphysics. Coupled with his rigorous training in science, this interest culminates in a number of books concerning the interconnections between modern science and the ancient wisdom of dharma: Dharmodynamics (2004), Neodharma (2012 and 2020), Dharmoscience (2012 and 2020), Sankhara (2014 and 2020) and Nirvana (2024). These books are well received in and outside of Thailand. At present, he regularly gives talks on these topics to monks and the lay public alike, both in Thailand and overseas.

Yet another distinct intellectual character of Woody is his inclination to think visually. He consistently employs diagrams and pictorial symbols to help him think through and solve the many diverse problems he faces over his career --academic or professional, business or personal, political or spiritual. All these are captured in his other book titled, Draw Your Thoughts (2014). On this front, he often shares his "visual thinking" skills and experiences through talks, lectures and workshops.

dharmoscience.title: Dharmascience
dharmoscience.shortDescription: Modern science, without a doubt, can be regarded as the pinnacle of human intellectual pursuit. Considering its recent emergence of only four or five hundred years since Galileo or Copernicus, science certainly has made remarkable progress and impact when compared to other intellectual traditions, either religious or secular. Aside from countless products and artifacts only made possible by modern technology, our way of looking at the world is also profoundly influenced by science. With this enormous success, science has become so confident in itself (sometimes bordering on arrogance) that it tends to overlook what other intellectual or spiritual traditions --particularly the age-old wisdom of religions and metaphysics – have to say.
dharmoscience.description: In another vein, the word dharma in Sanskrit, in its original and strictest sense, does not mean ethics or morality as commonly understood nowadays; but it means nature. The spiritual core of various eastern religions--particularly Buddhism, Taoism, Jainism and Hinduism-- is in fact the pursuit of true understanding of nature and its immutable laws in order for us to reach spiritual enlightenment and liberation. This is also the ultimate mission of science. In this sense, dharma is science; and science is dharma.
dharmoscience.additionalInfo1: This four-book set is an effort to combine and integrate modern science and age-old dharma into one fuller body of knowledge --dharmoscience-- in order to better describe the ultimate reality of nature. In other words, this is a novel attempt to scientifically formulate dharma; and at the same time broaden the horizon of modern science beyond the confines of the material realm.
dharmoscience.additionalInfo2: The four books making up this dharmoscience tetralogy are as follows: (1) Neodharma, (2) Dharmascience, (3) Sankhara, and (4) Nirvana. Within these books is where modern science and dharma converge.

neodharma.title: Neodharma
neodharma.shortDescription: Neodharma represents a revolutionary synthesis of ancient wisdom and modern scientific understanding, bridging the gap between traditional dharma teachings and contemporary knowledge.
neodharma.description: This foundational work explores how fundamental scientific principles align with dharmic wisdom, creating a new framework for understanding reality that encompasses both material and spiritual dimensions.
neodharma.additionalInfo1: Through careful analysis of quantum physics, consciousness studies, and ancient texts, Neodharma presents a unified theory that validates both scientific inquiry and spiritual insight.
neodharma.additionalInfo2: Essential for readers seeking to understand the convergence of modern science with timeless wisdom traditions, this book lays the groundwork for the entire Dharmoscience series.

sankhara.title: Sankhara
sankhara.shortDescription: An exploration of the Buddhist concept of Sankhara through the lens of modern physics and systems theory, revealing the interconnected nature of all phenomena.
sankhara.description: Sankhara examines the formations and constructions that shape our reality, both at the quantum level and in consciousness, demonstrating how ancient Buddhist insights align with cutting-edge scientific discoveries.
sankhara.additionalInfo1: This volume delves deep into the nature of conditioned existence, using both scientific methodology and contemplative analysis to understand how reality is constructed.
sankhara.additionalInfo2: Readers will discover how the principle of Sankhara operates across multiple scales, from subatomic particles to cosmic structures, revealing the unified nature of existence.

nirvana.title: Nirvana
nirvana.shortDescription: The culminating volume that presents Nirvana not as a mystical concept but as a scientifically understandable state of consciousness and being.
nirvana.description: Nirvana bridges the final gap between scientific understanding and spiritual realization, presenting liberation as both a psychological and physical phenomenon that can be approached through rigorous inquiry.
nirvana.additionalInfo1: Using insights from neuroscience, quantum physics, and meditation research, this book demonstrates how the state of Nirvana represents the natural conclusion of both scientific and spiritual investigation.
nirvana.additionalInfo2: This final volume synthesizes all previous insights into a comprehensive understanding of ultimate reality and the path to complete understanding and liberation.

drawYourThoughts.title: Draw Your Thoughts
drawYourThoughts.shortDescription: Unlocks the power of visual thinking to solve problems across diverse fields, from business and politics to metaphysics. This book offers fresh perspectives, enhancing decision-making and enriching both work and life.
drawYourThoughts.description: Draw Your Thoughts is a practical guide to harnessing visual thinking methodologies for enhanced problem-solving and creative analysis across multiple disciplines and life situations.
drawYourThoughts.additionalInfo1: Through proven techniques and real-world applications, readers learn to translate complex concepts into visual representations that facilitate deeper understanding and more effective communication.
drawYourThoughts.additionalInfo2: This comprehensive approach to visual thinking has been successfully applied in business strategy, policy development, and personal growth, making it an invaluable tool for professionals and lifelong learners.

tyrantHandbook.additionalInfo2: Essential reading for policy makers, public administrators, students of political science, and engaged citizens seeking to understand and improve governance systems.

theWayOut.title: Handbook for Thailand Recovery
theWayOut.shortDescription: A comprehensive roadmap for national recovery and sustainable development in Thailand.
theWayOut.description: This handbook provides detailed strategies and actionable solutions for addressing Thailand's complex socio-economic challenges through systematic reform and policy innovation.
theWayOut.additionalInfo1: Based on thorough analysis of successful recovery models from around the world, adapted specifically for Thailand's unique cultural and economic context.
theWayOut.additionalInfo2: An essential resource for policy makers, business leaders, and citizens committed to Thailand's sustainable development and prosperity.
